Description: Solid tumors are usually characterized by a high degree of complex somatic structural variation (SV) and revealing this genomic complexity is crucial for understanding the biology behind carcinogenesis. Current genomic tools are limited for this application because of low resolution (karyotype, FISH) or low sensitivity (NGS, chromosomal microarray).  Accurate high-resolution genome-wide approaches to comprehensively assess SVs including copy number variation, translocations, gene fusions, aneuploidy, and loss of heterozygosity are needed. Optical Genome Mapping the only technique providing sensitive, precise, and high-resolution structural variation analysis for clinical oncology research.
SearchResultBody: ESP29. Bionano Genomics: Application of Optical Genome Mapping for comprehensive genomic structural variation and HRD analysis from tumor biopsies
Title: Bionano Genomics: Application of Optical Genome Mapping for comprehensive genomic structural variation and HRD analysis from tumor biopsies
